components.text:
Web Application for home automation, the main function are:
- Programmable thermostat
- Display environmental temperature and humidity in real-time
- Comparison between energy power generated by photovoltaic system and power consumed in the home.

It is a IOT (Internet of things) solution, implemented on Raspberry 2, with the use of Wi-Fi sensor. The Web application is implemented with Meteor-Kitchen.

### Domoticasite Web Application for home automation, the main function are: - Programmable thermostat - Display environmental temperature and humidity in real-time - Comparison between energy power generated by photovoltaic system and power consumed in the home. It is a IOT (Internet of things) solution, implemented on Raspberry, with the use of Wi-Fi sensors. The Web application is implemented with Meteor-Kitchen. The project is an evolution of previous abandoned personal projects. ### Software: - Meteor (with meteor-kitchen) - Highcharts library - Apache2 (configured with proxypass) - EspEasy (firmware for ESP8266) ### Hardware: - Server Web: Raspberry Pi2 Model B - WiFi Module: ESP8266 - Sensors: DHT22 or Photoresistor

components.name: build
components.source:
### Build deploy app

On Windows:

    cd Domotica
    meteor build --architecture=os.linux.x86_64 --directory ../Domoticasite-node
    
    
Move Domoticasite-node/ on Raspberry     
    
    cd ../Domoticasite-node/programs/server
    npm install
    npm wiring-pi
    npm install git+https://github.com/HardwareProjects/node-dht-sensor.git (trick)

components.name: install_letsencrypt
components.source:
### Renew certificate every 90 days

There are problems with sslh to automatically renew the certificate, see:

https://github.com/certbot/certbot/issues/341 


So, mannualy make these commands:

    modify /etc/apache2/site
    modify /etc/apache2/site-enables/defaul.conf 4443 --> 433
    sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 stop
    sudo ./letsencrypt-auto certonly --standalone --email mtt_stt@yahoo.it -d matteosetti.noip.me

### Install dump1090-mutability

Required:

* Raspberry
* Apache 2.4
* dump1090-mutability


_add link to instruction_


### Configuring apache with dump1090-mutability

Add the following lines in /mods-enables/alias.conf:

    Alias "/data" "/run/dump1090-mutability"
    <Directory "/run/dump1090-mutability">
          Require all granted
    </Directory>

    Alias "/dump1090" "/usr/share/dump1090-mutability/html"
    <Directory "/usr/share/dump1090-mutability/html">
           Options Indexes FollowSymLinks MultiViews
           AllowOverride None
           Require all granted
           DirectoryIndex gmap.html
    </Directory>

components.name: install_markdown
components.source:
### Prepare production enviroment on Raspberry

With the following instructions you will be able prepare Raspberry for the first time.


* Install NPM e node-gyp ? ( I don't remebar)


* Install Universal fork on Meteor 1.3.4.1 

    cd $HOME
    git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/4commerce-technologies-AG/meteor.git

* Modify .bashrc (probably better /etc/envoroment ):

    alias meteor='$HOME/meteor/meteor'

* Check installed version:

    meteor --version

* Install mongodb
  In production eviroment you have install a dedicate server mongodb
  
    sudo apt-get install mongodb-server

* Install forever
Forever ia an seful command to lanch programs
  
    sudo npm install -g forever

In order to start job
    forever start Domoticasite-node/main.js

In order to stop job   
    forever stop Domoticasite-node/main.js

N.B.: Find logs in /home/pi/.forver
       
* Apply the following instructions in order to avoid use root account for wi-wiring:

    http://wiringpi.com/wiringpi-update-to-2-29/    


* Obtain Google credentials
  In order use google autentication, update the URI redirection in https://console.developers.google.com


* Create the following file in /home/pi/production-settings.json

    {"oauth": {
       "google": {"clientId": "XXX.apps.googleusercontent.com","secret": "XXX"}        
       }
    }


* Add the following lines in /etc/enviroment

    export WIRINGPI_GPIOMEM=1
    PORT=3000
    MONGO_URL=mongodb://localhost/Domoticasite
    ROOT_URL=https://matteosetti.noip.me


* Create the new file file /etc/profile.d/METEOR_SETTINGS.sh
  This is requested because production meteor app don't use --settings parameter. 

    export METEOR_SETTINGS=$(cat /home/pi/production-settings.json)


### Create Temporary site for tests

The Domoticasite was created with meteor-kitchen (http://www.meteorkitchen.com) - V0.9.78

* Download domoticasite.json for meteor-kitchen
* Because of meteor-kitchen doesn't work on Raspberry you have compile the Domoticasite on other systems, for example on Windows:

    `meteor-kitchen domoticasite.json Domoticasite --meteor-release 1.3.4.1`
    
* On Windows delete /Domoticasite/.meteor/local directory
* On Windows delete /Domoticasite/.meteor/versions file
* On Windows Uncomment rows on /Domoticasite/server/server.js
* Copy Windows Domoticasite directory on Raspberry (e.g. /home/pi/Domoticasite)
* On Raspberry cd in the Domoticasite dir and make:

    `meteor npm install --save wiring-pi`
    
    `meteor npm install --save git+https://github.com/HardwareProjects/node-dht-sensor.git`
    
* Lanch meteor on Raspbbery:

    `/usr/bin/nohup /home/pi/meteor/meteor --settings ../production-settings.json &`

* Wait and wait (the first time 2,5 hours)

* Go to http://localhost:3000

components.name: deploy_mkdown
components.source:
### Scripts fron Windows eviroment

Prerequisites:

1. Prepared Windows development enviroment
2. Prepared Raspberry production enviroment
3. Installed WINSCP on windows 


### BUILD
  
meteor-kitchen ./Domoticasite.json ./Domoticasite --meteor-release 1.3.4.1
cd ./Domoticasite
meteor build --architecture=os.linux.x86_64 --directory ../DomoticasiteP



### DEPLOY

npm install --save wiring-pi
npm install --save git+https://github.com/HardwareProjects/node-dht-sensor.git
npm install
forever start mains.js


@echo off

"C:\Program Files (x86)\WinSCP\WinSCP.com" ^
  /log="C:\Users\Sonia\Documents\GitHub\Domoticasite\WinSCP.log" /ini=nul ^
  /command ^
    "open sftp://pi:XXXXXX@192.168.1.130:443/ -hostkey=""ssh-rsa 2048 38:b5:a9:b0:f9:94:c3:3d:98:65:df:d3:77:56:7d:01""" ^   
    "ls" ^
    "call /home/pi/.nvm/versions/node/v6.7.0/bin/forever stop 0" ^
    "call rm -rf /home/pi/DomoticasiteP" ^
    "mkdir /home/pi/DomoticasiteP" ^
    "put C:\Users\Sonia\Documents\GitHub\Domoticasite\DomoticasiteP\* /home/pi/DomoticasiteP" ^
    "cd /home/pi/DomoticasiteP/programs/server" ^
    "call /usr/local/bin/npm install" ^
    "call /usr/local/bin/npm install --save wiring-pi" ^     
    "call /usr/local/bin/npm install git+https://github.com/HardwareProjects/node-dht-sensor.git --save" ^
    "call /home/pi/.nvm/versions/node/v6.7.0/bin/forever start /home/pi/DomoticasiteP/main.js" ^             
    "exit"

set WINSCP_RESULT=%ERRORLEVEL%
if %WINSCP_RESULT% equ 0 (
  echo Success
) else (
  echo Error
)

exit /b %WINSCP_RESULT%

components.name: config_apache2_mkdown
components.source:
### Configuring apache 2.4.10 with meteor

/sites-enables/default-ssl.conf

    <IfModule mod_ssl.c>
        <VirtualHost _default_:4443>
                ServerName matteosetti.noip.me
                ServerAdmin mtt_xxx@yahoo.it
                ErrorLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/error.log
                CustomLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/access.log combined

                SSLEngine on
                SSLProxyEngine On
                ProxyRequests Off

                SSLCertificateFile /etc/letsencrypt/live/matteosetti.noip.me/cert.pem
                SSLCertificateKeyFile /etc/letsencrypt/live/matteosetti.noip.me/privkey.pem
                SSLCertificateChainFile /etc/letsencrypt/live/matteosetti.noip.me/chain.pem
                SSLCACertificatePath /etc/ssl/certs/

                DocumentRoot /var/www/123solar

                <Location /webcam/>
                       ProxyPass http://192.168.1.104:88/
                       ProxyPassReverse http://192.168.1.104:88/
                </Location>

                ProxyPass /123solar http://localhost/123solar
                ProxyPassReverse /123solar http://localhost/123solar

                ProxyPass /dump1090/ http://localhost/dump1090/
                ProxyPassReverse /dump1090/ http://localhost/dump1090/

                ProxyPass / http://localhost:3000/
                ProxyPassReverse / http://localhost:3000/

                RewriteEngine on
                RewriteCond %{HTTP:UPGRADE} ^WebSocket$ [NC]
                RewriteCond %{HTTP:CONNECTION} ^Upgrade$ [NC]
                RewriteRule .* ws://localhost:3000%{REQUEST_URI} [P]
                
                BrowserMatch "MSIE [2-6]" \
                nokeepalive ssl-unclean-shutdown \
                downgrade-1.0 force-response-1.0
                # MSIE 7 and newer should be able to use keepalive
                BrowserMatch "MSIE [17-9]" ssl-unclean-shutdown

        </VirtualHost>
</IfModule>

components.name: hw_esp8266_markdown
components.source:
### Wiring ESP8266-01

1. VCC & CH_PD -> 3.3V
2. GPIO0 & GND -> GND
3. RX -> TX
4. TX -> RX

=> Wiring ESP8266 Remember to put GPIO 0 to GND during flashing.

### Wiring ESP8266-12

1. VCC & CH_PD & GPIO0 --> VCC
2. GND & GP015 --> GND
3. RX -> TX
4. TX -> RX

=> Wiring ESP8266 Remember to put GPIO 0 to GND during flashing.

### Instructions to prepare firmware the ESP8266** (release 1.1.0)

1. Download source from (https://github.com/ESP8266nu/ESPEasy) EspEasy > R64
2. follow the instrucions http://www.esp8266.nu/index.php/Tutorial_Arduino_Firmware_Upload
3. Wiring ESP8266 Remeber to put GPIO 0 to GND during flashing.
4. Configure Device section of ESPEasy

### Instructions to upload EspEasy ESP8266-01 with Arduino 1.6.5

1. Flash Size: 512K (64 SPIFF)
2. Upload speed: 9600

components.name: hw_pulse_markdown
components.source:
### ESPEASY Rules
This solution is too expensive, too many http get:

    On System#Boot do    
      SendToHTTP 192.168.1.130,8081,/lux/Reboot
    endon

    on Pulse#Count>0 do
     SendToHTTP 192.168.1.130,8081,/lux/[Pulse#Count],[Pulse#Total]
    endon

---------------------
Better send "count" pulse every minute:


    on Pulse#Count do
      SendToHTTP 192.168.1.130,8081,/lux/[Pulse#Count],[Pulse#Total]
    endon
    
(remeber put Delay = 60 on sensor tab)

------------------------
### Measure KW from the numebr of pulses:

KWatt = (3600/(1000 x seconds)) x pulses
